Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Larissa1980
Reviews.Content: Amazing design, great location, super staff! Love the newly renovated rooms, the art is bright and original and adds a nice punch to the rooms. The shower is fabulous and even the towels and linens are first class. Also the lobby design is super successful in creating multiple spaces for guests to read, work, and watch the news...based on hotel rates in the area I think this property is a great value. It is close to the best of Seattle and a great place to come back to after a long day of exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: bsmith1570
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here.They are under construction. They did not tell us upon checking in, so... imagine my surprise at 8am when the started jackjammering on the floor below me. The remodle looks nice, and I'm sure it will be a wonderful place to stay AFTER they are finished.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place--Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ilwacohawk
Reviews.Content: This is a funky hotel in a great location. Walking distance to the Seattle Center and Space Needle and Pike Street Market. It was being renovated when we were there and the 2nd floor wasn't completed yet. The room was nice. It had hardwood floors, coffee pot, funky bathroom. I would rate this place a 4, but we could not get very hot water. We had breakfast at the restaurant and it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jeroen H
Reviews.Content: Spend 190 dollar for one night. Hotel is currently being renovated, but this is done with Ikea furniture. And the old heater was still present, and it had seen better days.... Allthough it is all resently done, paint was chipping, and one of the carpets was stained. The room was also noisy, this mainly from other rooms. On the plus side, it is located within a walking distance of the space needle, and pikes market. So it isn't all bad :). If the prices were a lower this could be decent option.

Reviews.Title: “hotel five in seattle.....great value”
Reviews.Author: ncparseeker
Reviews.Content: Small things are important.....Kuerig coffee and tea, water, cupcakes, nice folks. A great value for this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service & comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: TararaD
Reviews.Content: Booked a few short days before a recent girls weekend to Seattle. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and exceeded expectations. We walked all weekend, to the market, EMP, waterfront, underground tour - nothing was more than 20 mins away. We'd forgotten umbrellas and asked if there was a shop nearby where we could pick one up - instantly two complimentary ones were produced from under the counter. Small value ads like this, as well as cupcakes upon arrival, free wifi, etc were much appreciated. Like other reviewers the noise from adjoining rooms and hall was the only drawback, and we discovered that the TV speakers were on the rear of TV so it needed to be turned up unnecessarily loud (which would explain why our neighbours was so high). That being said, the pros far outweighed the cons and it was overall of excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel. Cheap Remodel”
Reviews.Author: Tarrega
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on the photos they advertised. First the room was small. They advertised large for seattle; it's not. Second, the room was set up with "ikea" style dorm furniture. The place just received a very cheap remodel and the entire hotel smells of paint. The floors are a cheap hard laminate that is supposed to look like wood. The result is that sound carries very well. I heard doors slamming all night. It is not near the market, it is a 10 min walk. The space needle is about 6 min walk. They requested a card for incidentals. It's been two weeks and the hold has not dropped off. I called and was told by the desk clerk that her manager would take care of it. The manager did not. I emailed the hotel and got no reply. I called my Credit Card company and was told that because I used a prepaid debit card that it would take 30 days. There are much better hotels for the money. Rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Courteous and Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: P A
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Clean, courteous service, super comfortable bed--including pillows, linens and not just the mattress--and bright, contemporary decor. It's centrally located in the downtown. And they allowed our dog. Unfortunately, for a small fee, but at least he was welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great deal.”
Reviews.Author: pdfleck
Reviews.Content: I recently booked two nights at this hotel. It was an amazing spot for a tourist. The rooms were nice, products were great (coffee, shampoo, lotion, bodywash, etc.) and all around a great place to stay. The staff were very nice and attentive. The little cupcakes at check-in? Oh yeah... It is in the middle of EVERYTHING. Perfect for a weekend stay. You can easily walk to The Space Needle, EMP, Science Museum, Pike Place Market, The Seattle Aquarium and countless other great places. EASY access to public transit. As other reviewers have stated, the hotel is under construction. We were there two nights and didn't hear a sound. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal For Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last week, literally the night before I was traveling to Seatlle, I was impressed that they had the availability in the room I wanted, and how reasonable the price was, originally I booked only one night, but ended up staying a second night. The location is literally in the middle of downtown just off the main drag, and the monorail runs next the the hotel. I must say I was happy with my choice, the staff was awesome and very friendly, and to add, the cafe down stairs has great american homey food. I Will definently stay here next trip to seatlle.

Reviews.Title: “Best mid priced hotel downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Broadbandcowboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at hotel five on 3 trips in the last 6 months. This is usually the lowest priced mid range hotel in downtown. If you can find the 3rd night free promotion it's the best deal in town for a mid range hotel. I will be back with the 3rd night free promotion. Pros: close to everything downtown, a short walk from the bus tunnel, very clean, updated rooms, great rates, free internet, friendly staff. Cons: it can be loud - thin walls & noise in the hallway can be heard in your room. Small excercise area. As others have noted the hotel is remodeling, but only once did noise bother me. This was due to the fact that the walls are thin more than construction. Overall, it's a great mid priced downtown hotel. Don't miss Top Pot next door -- it's a must for any Seattle visitor!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Great location”
Reviews.Author: biztraveller25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for a couple nights back in November. The pros: rate was good (booked on-line at hotel website), location was in Belltown (next to Top Pot Donuts and easy walking to downtown Seattle) and hotel and my room was nicely renovated. Note that the hotel is renovated, not new. As such, there are a few things that seemed old such as the heating unit. It was noisy (but not bothersome to me). Also, there is free water, coffee and wifi in the room. One other thing is that the bathroom noices were very audible in the next room. A better door/fan system would be appreciated. Overall, this is a good hotel and a good price and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, reasonable value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Boriski
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was over four nights at an average rate of $104/night, including tax (booked direct on the Hotel's website). This was our 19th hotel stay in around 14 weeks of travel across North America. Overall: A comfortable, modern room, close to Seattle restaurants in Belltown, with a little noise. Probably best for those wanting just a few nights in a good location from Sundays through Wednesdays. What's good: Our room was brightly painted with new, modern decor including a leather foot stool, soft timber flooring, a renovated bathroom with a modern, large showerhead, and a keurig (coffee) machine with a selection of assorted coffees and tea. Towels were the fluffiest weâ€™ve had at any hotel. An in-room safe was available. Our king-size bed was really comfortable. Pillow comfort is quite personal though we didnâ€™t really like ours â€“ a heavy style that compress into a hard slope. Heating was good and quiet. Breakfast was not included in our rate and thereâ€™s no refrigerator or microwave in the room. A restaurant on the ground floor provides breakfast and lunch until 1:30pm. We ate breakfast there one morning â€“ tea/toast/juice ($7), and oatmeal ($5). Breakfast prices were reasonable, and service good. Free coffee and mini cupcakes were available in the hotel foyer after the restaurant closes each day (after 3pm), and a free local newspaper was available at reception. If you donâ€™t like packet creamer in your coffee, pick a few small tubs of liquid creamer from the coffee stand in reception for use with the machine in your room. Minor annoyances: Some noise from what we assumed were hotel renovations in progress (black construction plastic on a few windows on the second floor and we were woken before 8am on Saturday morning by intermittent hammering in the building for several hours), major building construction diagonally across Blanchard St (likely for at least the next 6 months), and hotel hallways. The hotel has a policy of putting a â€˜holdâ€™ of $20/day on your credit card to allow for â€˜contingenciesâ€™. We had no problem with the money being released against our debit card, but be aware of the practice. Our room (#533) was on the fifth (and top) floor facing Blanchard Street, more towards the end of the corridor (third last room), away from lifts and a drink/snack machine. The timber floors reflect most hallway conversations, footsteps and slamming doors, and Iâ€™d recommend an ipod or earplugs if you want a peaceful nightâ€™s sleep. The weekend nights seemed noisier and busier, with party goers returning early in the morning, and a local football game and bus load of fans as hotel guests also made for a noisy Friday night stay. The building has two lifts which worked quickly, and drink/snack/ice machines are available. Nearby: Top Pot Doughnuts across the road on 5th are a must. Ralphâ€™s Grocery & Deli is a few blocks away for cheap and wholesome soups and sandwhiches. Youâ€™ll find plenty of restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel, in the Belltown area. Try Mamaâ€™s Mexican for grungy ambience, and good value large-sized mexican meals. Pike Place Market is a great walk of around 5 blocks (try the Russian Bakery and check out Starbuckâ€™s first ever store), and city stores are a similar distance. The Space Needle is an easy, half mile walk. For something unusual/different: Wexley School for Girls is an advertising agency along 5th â€“ look through their windows; Thereâ€™s colourful knitting around the trees in the park on 3rd Avenue & Yesler Way/Jefferson St. Transport: Seattle has free buses in the downtown area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crandy84
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with everything you need for a great price. Rooms are really spacious and very clean. The hotel is also very 'funky' the decor and furniture is very retro. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location is also great, everything is within walking distance. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Seattle. We stayed for 3 nights but only paid for 2 as part of a promotion they were offering which was also great and made this even better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of Consideration When Planning a Stay in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JKPDX
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at Hotel Five. We stayed for two nights arriving on November 4th and departing on November 6th. While I would recommend the hotel in the end, there were a few concerns and criticisms I had, which I will address here. I think the hotel has a lot going for it and the pluses certainly outweigh the minuses. However, I would recommend doing your research and determining if the hotel fits your needs prior to making a reservation. First of all, the reviews on Trip Advisor should only be given your consideration if they have been placed since the transition from Ramada to Hotel Five. The latter has only had the property for less than a year, I believe, and renovations and construction are still underway. They were renovating the second and third floors when we stayed on the property. It would be wrong to crucify the current ownership for the failings of the previous folks. They are clearly still working out the quirks and constructive feedback from folks such as us will help them in refining their transition for the better. Anyway, I made our reservation by calling the hotel directly and negotiating a rate. The man I spoke to was very nice. He offered a Fifth Avenue queen for $123.00 per night. The conditions were that by making the purchase more than 21 days in advance I could secure that rate, but I would have to pay in advance and it was non refundable. I did so and originally made a reservation for the nights of October 28th and October 29th. However, a family emergency came up and required that our trip be cancelled or rescheduled. To their credit Pineapple, the owners, were in fact willing to let me reschedule for the following weekend. I truly expected they would tell me I was up a creek and they could care less while keeping my "non refundable" money since those were the terms I agreed to. Although, the women I spoke to did add that the rate might change for the alternate dates I was choosing. I had no problem with this, but what I did take offense to was what she said next. She indicated that if the rate were to be higher than the $123.00 I had already paid that they WOULD charge me the difference. However, if the rate was lower, "Unfortunately we are NOT able to refund any difference back to you." So, in other words they have no qualms about asking for more money, but are tight fisted about offering any savings back to the guest. When I inquired further, the representative could not really offer me an explanation as to why this is. Then, sure enough, she informed me that the room I was staying in was available for $101.00 per night. I had surrendered an additional $44.00 for it over two nights. I had read from previous reviewers that the hotel had given them vouchers for the lobby diner during their stays. I was hoping they might offer $10.00 or $20.00 in such to me as a kind gesture given the rate difference, but I had no such luck. Given that they were willing to amend my reservation dates I decided to just take the loss in the end. On the day of the our arrival I tried calling the hotel twice just to confirm my reservation and to inform them of our likely arrival time. To my suprise, and annoyance, I listened to an automated recording tell me to press one button to speak to a current guest and another to make a reservation, then simply repeat itself. What about an option to speak to the front desk? When I called the third time during the drive up from Portland that evening, I finally spoke to an actual person who answered the phone. Check in was easy and the man on duty was friendly. I believe it may have been the same man I spoke with when I made my reservation initially. There are no bell hops, but you can pull right up to the front door with your car. The entrace is covered and well lit. The parking lot is tight and the spots are narrow, but I made it work. The parking rate for guests is $15.00 per night. My only annoyance upon check in was the agent questioned my room rate once more, despite my having pre-paid and the conversation I had had with Pineapple's reservation center. Perhaps I sound like I am being a tightwad here? But, if you were quoted a rate and told it was the lowest rate available. Then, you are sent a reservation confirmation that lists a rate $22.00 per night cheaper, but told that you are out of luck and to consider yourself lucky they were even willing to amend your previous reservation. Would you then be annoyed at the prospect of potentially being asked for pay even more upon check in? While this annoyed me, I do want to add the counter agent was exceedingly polite and professional, even amidst this. He did not attempt to charge me a higher rate in the end, but he did inform me that I should not have been granted a reservation change at all per the terms of my original reservation and rate. I tend to see it differently, as did the woman who made the change for me to begin with. She had said that if someone was seeking to stay at one of their properties as a guest, then their duty should be to try and accomodate that request, not to scold them over fine print and terms. Anyway, one last thing to share is the hotel runs $20.00 per night initially upon your credit card to cover incidentals. I found this reasonable compared to other hotels which block our hundreds of dollars without seeking permission. The room we stayed in, number 517, was nice and exactly as the pictures describe. There is a blackout shade on the window which is nice for sleeping and a second privacy shade which allows for sunlight. Everything in the room was nearly new. We enjoyed some television in bed after gorging at the Cheesecake Factory the second night. Although the cable channel selection is very basic and limited. There are also no in room pay movies, nor dvd players. The counter agent did mention to another man checking in prior to us that they are working on the adding the former amenity, I believe. There is a nice single cup coffee maker in the room with plenty of supplies, ice bucket with accessories, and complimentary bottled water. The washrooms are quite nice. They are tiled with dispensers of moisturizer, soap, shampoo, and conditioner. The shower had a nice cascading shower head which was to die for. There was also an in room safe, which I appreciated and utilized. There was a hair dryer, iron, and ironing board. We called the desk for extra coat hangers and they brought some up almost immediately. We used the complimentary wi fi each day. Now, with that said, when I said to do your research and decide if the hotel is right for you, this is what I was referring to. The rooms are newly renovated, artsy, and it is clear the owners are putting a lot of work into the place. However, I could honestly see how the property would not be for everyone. Some folks are bound to find fault. One woman we encountered in the elevator one evening made the observation of, "They are a lot like dorm rooms, aren't they?" The property is not a five star. No bell hops, room service, continental breakfast, etc. If you want that drive six blocks or so south and stay at the Westin. The rooms are not large. This is where I think the comment of the lady in the elevator fits in.They suited us fine as a couple, but if I were travelling with a family or children I would be hesitant, even with a double. Our room had a bed a small desk area and one plush chair with a small ottoman. There is not a lot of room to stretch out. What this property truly has going for it is the location. We left the car idle all weekend and walked everywhere. The monorail passed by our window and I truly loved it. I would perhaps recommend a Space Needle view room, but avoid the courtyard on the backside and the city views are limited as well. Ask to face fifth avenue or the needle. Also, try to get a room on the top froor if you can. Our room looked almost window to window into the passing monorails, which I enjoyed for watching the people. The Top Pot Donuts a block away is adorable and a must see for the ambiance and a cup of coffee. The historic Cinerama is a block away as well. We walked to the shopping district and even to Seattle Center and the Ride the Ducks easily. We even walked to Pikes Market and to Capital Hill for nightlife. The latter took about fifteen minutes. We took a taxi back from the hill one evening and walked the other evening without incident. Seattle does has a problem with aggressive pan handlers and mentally ill homeless folks accosting tourists verbally, but we never felt unsafe, even at 3:00 a.m. And, we saw none of this near the hotel at all. It is more of a problem in the shopping blocks. Case in point, the Cheesecake Factory is a magnet for such activity in. There is a visible police presence in the downtown area though. We saw many, many police officers. Finally, other than the annoyance about the room rate, I would say my only other true criticism was the room cleanliness. By this I mean the room was clean, but not deep cleaned. The floors are tile in the bathrooms and hardwoods in the rooms themselves. The issue I took was with the amounts of dust I found in every cranny and covered area of the hardwoods. I discovered this because upon check in I did what is an unfortunate must when staying in ANY hotel these days, which is inspect the room for any signs of bed bugs. Thankfully I found none at all! However, under the bed was filthy with dust and their bunnies as well as all around the room where the baseboards meet the floors, under all of the furniture pieces, etc. When I removed the cushion from the chair it was a mess of crumbs and whatnot. It appeared the crevices had never been vacuumed. I was not saying the room was filthy with grime and unhygienic. That was not the case at all! However, if you have ever had a bedroom with hard wood flooring you will know what I mean. Periodically you need to vacuum and mop underneath the bed and in every last inch of every place. In your living room you have to vacuum our your couch and chairs once in awhile. If I were the housekeeping manger I would insist upon a deep cleaning of every room, not as part of daily service necessarily, but upon the turnover from one guest to the next that included thorough dusting, mopping, and vacuuming. Finally, I was very disappointed to also notice there was no encasement upon the mattress or boxspring as a preventative measure to stop the unwanted invading bed bugs. I do not think the hotel has a problem with such. Let me stress that. However, I would have liked to have seen evidence that, given the growing problem it is becoming and the amount of work they are putting into the property, that the hotel is taking a proactive and preventative approach to protecting their guests and their investment. Little things like this and the dirt and dust in the room are what prevented me from giving this review five stars. Thorough cleaning and regular inspections of their newly renovated rooms to protect their guests and investment would make me a definite repeat guest. I recommend this hotel be upon your short list of potential choices in Seattle. Just see if it fits your needs logistically and be sure to negotiate your rate.

Reviews.Title: “Funky surprise”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights this September. Pretty convenient location. Right by Top Pot Donuts and a bunch of other restaurants. Done up pretty differently compared to your run of the mill hotels. It was a nice stay overall. Rooms were nice and the bathrooms were pretty cool. Toilet area is kinda dark though. One nice surprise was the fact that you couldnt hear the monorail. Probably more a function of the monorail than the hotel, but nice nonetheless. Best surprise was how good breakfast was at the restaurant. Keep in mind that its in transition, so the lower levels may not match the new parts.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Close to Walking Sites Downtown”
Reviews.Author: pilotspeedo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel Five and were very pleased with the customer service and cleanliness of the room. Wish they had a complimentary breakfast, but they did have a restaurant nearby with complimentary coffee always available. It was also near a great donut store (Top Pot) within easy walking distance. We will stay there again on our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: twodognight
Reviews.Content: We visited Seattle for a week and stayed at Hotel Five, which was a Ramada that has been refurbished. It is the basic hotel with a clean, comfortable rooms and updated bathrooms. It has been redecorated with modern furnishings and bright paint colors so it's very eye catching! It's location is right on 5th Ave. so if you go, ask for a room at the back of the hotel and preferably on the 4th or 5th floor. The walls are a little thin so you might want to sleep with earplugs - I do no matter what hotel I stay in - but you can't beat the location. It is in walking distance to all the sites downtown, close to the market, restaurants, Space Needle, etc. Be sure to check out the glass blowing shop across the street and down from the hotel. Wow! The room price is reasonable for Seattle and we enjoyed our stay there. It's a good value especially in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: kenan76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Five for a trip mid-September. First off, the hotel is in a fantastic location - I took the link train from the airport and got off at the Westlake station Downtown. The hotel is about 5 blocks north, a very easy walk. Check-in was a breeze, and the front desk staff gave me quick and efficient directions to get to Safeco Field because I had Mariners tickets that evening. The room was nice, appreciated the coffee maker and selection of coffee, and the bottled water. This hotel is convenient for sightseeing. An easy walk to Pike Place Market, 2 blocks to the monorail station to get to Seattle Center and the Space Needle. I highly recommend this hotel, and keep an eye out for third night free promotions on their web site - it makes a good deal even better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: asher9487
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fifth floor of this hotel and it had been recently renovated. The bedrooms were true to the pictures online. It was nice to stay in a room that still smelled brand new and clean. Each room has a Keurig coffee machine and complementary coffee and water bottles in the room that are refreshed each day. The rooms have nice, soft sheets and linens. The showers are amazing. The new decorations are hip, funky and trendy. We had a beautiful view of the city from our room (you can pick a city view or Space Needle view). The location is central to all tourist attractions, which is really nice. The downfall of the rooms is that you can hear a lot of noise between rooms and in the hallway. The only bad thing that happened was when we checked in. We were told we would get one night free for every three nights we stayed (meaning two free nights for our six night stay). However we already got an early booking fee discount and you could not combine the two offers. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget who is looking for a nice hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “What a find! One word....FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights from 6th September to 13th September 2011 and ALL aspects were fabulous. I have traveled extensively and Hotel Five is a real diamond!! Upon arrival the service from staff was fantastic and this continued throughout the whole stay, they are a credit to the hotel. The hotel is a boutique style but that's what we like - the service is much more personal and standards much higher than the larger chains, which normally don't give a damn. We stayed on their 3rd night free deal (see their website for details) so actually got 2 of our nights free which was incredible value - but they went a stage further and although it was advertised as a room only rate, upon arrival we were given $20 vouchers for each day of our stay to use toward food and beverage at Max's Cafe ($140 value!!) - Truly awesome!!! And with the most expensive item on the menu at $11, we ate breakfast or lunch free except for a few bucks tip - well deserved for the great food and service. Location wise the hotel is great, walking distance from the Waterfront, Space Needle, Downtown, Westlake and the Light Rail stop for the Airport is a mere 4 minute, 3 block walk!! Oh, not forgetting Top Pot donuts almost next door, which you simply have to try!! The decor of the hotel is very modern, retro style with bold colours - so I guess maybe not to all tastes but we loved it. The rooms are light, airy and well equipped and the bathrooms simply fabulous, although no bath tub but large walk in shower. Our room had a flat screen brand new TV, air-conditioning, free tea and coffee making facilities, safe, iron and ironing board, telephone with voicemail and a very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. On top of this, fresh bottled water was free in our room everyday and WIFI completely free throughout the hotel. We did experience a little noise at times from the corridor and some street noise - but it was minimal, and absolutely no different to any other hotel I have stayed in. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough as a boutique hotel, if you want hotel facilities such as gym, healthclub, swimming pool etc then this is not the place, but hey, that's reflected in the low pricing!!! I have seen this hotel rated as low as a 2 star which is ridiculous, but the lack of facilities causes this, not the quality. If it had a quality and value rating it would be a 5!!!! This hotel is getting an undeserved lower score, due only to the fact that it used to be a rubbish Ramada and has received poor reviews back then - this is so unfair. IF YOU STAY HERE AND LIKE IT, please write a review!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value with Awesome Central Location”
Reviews.Author: sandyv121
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 5th Floor of this adorable updated and modern hotel for Bumbershoot Music Festival. The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful as far as directions and suggestions for dinner. The hotel is well situated on 5th Avenue, a 10-12 minute walk from the Space Needle and about a 15-20 minute walk from Pike Market, (I walk fast!) and all that wonderful shopping in the CBD. The rooms are spacious, very clean and well appointed...nice flat screen TV, alarm clock with Ipod dock, spacious bathroom, nice bath products, fluffy towels, blow dryer, etc Bed and pillows - super comfy. We took advantage of the 21 day advance rate and was $92/night - which was a STEAL! I would absolutely stay at this property again. PS - Steps away to a great little supermarket on 4th Avenue that does the best BLT ever...also, a very busy donut shop on 5th avenue if you are into that. :-) Thanks hotel Five - made my time in Seattle that much more memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda L
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms traveling before a cruise. The staff here was excellent went out of their way for you, very friendly and courteous. Loved the rooms and art deco decor. Very clean and the pillows were extremely comfortable. We hung out in the lobby they made us feel very much at home! Also very close to the Space Needle, Pike's Market and the Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Modern Decor”
Reviews.Author: Coopercoy
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Five since it was the only hotel available and we're glad we did! It's in a great location, close to Downtown, the many restaurants of Belltown, and the Waterfront. In regards to people saying it's a sketchy area, I think that it is more up and coming than a bad area. We felt safe even when walking home at night (although I'd never recommend walking alone in any city at night). The decor of the hotel is very modern. The lobby was large and inviting and free coffee and mini cupcakes were out often for guests. We stayed in two different rooms since we went to San Juan for a night in between (and they happily held our luggage for us for the night). The first room was a 4th floor queen room right outside the monorail, which is literally the quietest form of transportation. You couldn't even tell when it went by! The second room was a king room on the 5th floor. Pros: Keurig coffee maker with choice of coffee, decaf, or tea, Rain shower, Free Wifi, friendly front desk, great location, clean rooms, interesting decor Cons: Slow Wifi (especially in my 5th floor room), Safe in 3rd floor room didn't work, I wasn't a fan of their highly fragranced shower products, absolutely no spot to hang towels in my 5th floor bathroom, painting over bed was missing in my 5th floor room, itchy comforter, limited TV stations I think they might still be finishing their renovations, which is was the painting was missing, but both rooms I stayed in were clean and comfortable. We had both rooms facing the monorail & 5th ave but it looked like if you stay in the other hallway, you might have views of the space needle! I definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking to explore Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTravellers
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Five, newly renovated with funky brightly coloured decor. Its location isn't right in the centre of downtown but still only about 10 minutes walk away and felt safe. The room was clean and of a good size, had free internet, a coffee maker, a super comfortable bed and fantastic shower, in fact the rainhead's pressure was perhaps a little too vigorous! We got a great deal through the hotel when we booked as they were offering a third night free so it made the stay good value overall. It also included $20 breakfast vouchers for two each morning at their inhouse cafe, where the staff were friendly and the breakfast very good. I used their gym on a couple of occasions which was small but clean. My only criticism would be that the check-in person could have been a little more welcoming and friendly, he wasn't rude but just a little aloof and a smile would have gone a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, fun decor, exceeded expectations and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Five exceeded my expectations. I stayed with my sisters in the executive suite on the fifth floor which had a sleek and modern style in the renovated part of the hotel. It was clean, comfortable and the staff was incredibly hospitable. Thank you to Julia, the manager who ensured we had a wonderful stay and upgraded our room. I stayed here 2 years ago when it was the ramada, had an unpleasant experience, did not want to come back and Julia convinced me to try Hotel Five. It is so modern and inviting now. I recommend Hotel Five, especially the renovated floors (4th and 5th).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dei999
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Not a basic hotel from a national chain. Front desk were very helpful in receiving some packages and also giving us ideas of where to go for dinner and to listen to music. Complimentary coffee and cookies/muffins were also a plus. Room was clean and colorful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot-would visit again!”
Reviews.Author: APfromLA
Reviews.Content: We visited our son who was working in South Lake Union for the summer and needed a hotel close to everything (in walking distance!) that was reasonable in price. Hotel Five was a great solution-the location is fantastic, towels were thicker than usual, beds were comfy. The double queen room was a little small for three people but we made do. We were on the fourth floor facing a parking lot and heard no outside noises. We had a visitor, also from out of town, who needed driving directions to his hotel in the suburbs after joining us for dinner one night. The hotel clerks did a Google map search and printed out maps for him to use-I thought that was super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Never even made it in the door!”
Reviews.Author: mpfdjf
Reviews.Content: I booked our vacation with Ramada (seattle) back in February 2011 (got a confirmation number, etc...). I called one week before our trip in the end of July to get directions from the airport to the hotel. Learned the hotel was sold to Hotel Five. They did not have our reservation under my name or confirmation number and was told they had no rooms available. We were never notified of the sale or the fact that our reservation was not honored. If I never called we would have shown up at the door without having a room. We weren't able to get any reservations in town (unless I wanted to pay double at that late notice). Ended up finding a placed near University of Washington and we had to pay for town car services to town each day (something I didn't figure into our budget). Believe me the better business bureau, the chamber of commerce and any place else I can notify will hear about there service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: rmgatlanta
Reviews.Content: Was unsure about this hotel after reading some of the reviews and when I first walked into the hotel. The decor is an attempt towards the trendy but as I stood in the lobby, I was worried this would be a shabby hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by the room though. It first reminded me of my college dorm room but then I took in the nice hardwood floors, the very clean room, and the comfortable bed. The bathroom was spacious, clean and had a great shower. The room has free wi-fi, good coffee maker, iron, hairdryer etc. It was a very comfortable stay and I was pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “They will try and bump you”
Reviews.Author: Fatveg
Reviews.Content: This is not a $200 hotel. But that is what I had to pay at the time, and yet they still tried to bump me, to the Maxwell. For those who dont know Seattle, this is a dodgy area, the Maxwell Is way out in an even worse area. Staff were pleasant and tried to fix things, but I will never book here again as I cannot guarantee where I will end up. Avoid this place and stick with places that honor your booking. I did eventually stay here as I refused to be bumped, but make no mistake: this is a $69 ramada, if you get it for that then fine, if you pay any more it's robbery. Don't expect to be warned if you are bumped, I didn't find out till I tried to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great lodging, I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: huskiemom_11
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Maxwell Hotel on Roy last summer, and wanted to go back, however, there were no rooms available. They recommended Hotel 5 as it's owned by the same company. Reviews were less than glowing, but they said they had just finished a complete remodel, and the price was right, location excellent. I was not disappointed. The rooms are clean and inviting, bedding was luxurious, and the staff friendly and very helpful. And, the rooms were so quiet, you didn't hear the rooms next door. I would highly recommend this hotel, as well as the Maxwell. They owners know what they're doing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adnama90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 5 at the end of June, not knowing what to expect. The website has some pictures, but none that really show what the hotel really looks like. It is very modern and walking distance to pretty much anything. The main purpose of my visit was to shop and go to a ball game. It was a 10 min walk to where all the great downtown shopping spots are and about a $15 cab ride to Safeco. Not to mention it was a short walk to Pike Place Market and a 2 minute walk from a grocery store. I will most definitely be staying at Hotel 5 when I come back to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a Hojo!”
Reviews.Author: HobokenFamily
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel when it was the Ramada and however when we called in the middle of May to confirm our reservation (my family and I like being prepared). There was no notification that the name of the hotel had changed (I can see why the Ramada Chain dropped them!). When my family and I flew into Seattle from Hoboken, it was already very late and our 3 & 4 yr old girls were very tired and just wanted to sleep. We went searching for the hotel in the dark in our rental car even though we had GPS the city impacted the signal, we contacted the hotel and was give bad directions. So after about 30 minutes being lost downtown we stopped at the Westin and asked where this hotel was, luckily they pointed us to the right direction however I wish we did stay at the Westin. Finally arrived at the hotel and it was nothing like I had booked! The hotel had little to no parking and expected me to pay $24/night for parking my SUV, I told them when I booked I was never told of any parking fees! I asked for them to cancel my reservation and they refused to cancel it. They said it was against new hotel policy. I asked to speak with the manager and allegedly she wasn't in. Apparently the hotel had a renovation, but the smell was overwhelming and made my wife sick to her stomach. We stayed the night against our will. The problems we encountered were so excessive that I don't know how the owners can justify the hotel or it's management. The next morning I discussed our situation with the manager 'Julia' and she stated that if we didn't like it we could checkout but a refund for the unused nights takes 7-10 business days to process. I requested a full refund and she told me we used the room for 1 night so we weren't justified for a full refund (we had a 7 day reservation). The beds were terrible and lumpy, same with the pillows. Toilet ran all night even after numerous calls. Put next to Elevators after being requested not to. High Speed (HSA) was so slow! This manager was one of the worst I have ever encountered. I will never stay here at this motel again. Yes the doughnuts at Top Pot were delicious, however we moved to the Westin and I tell you it made such a huge difference. When in Seattle You get what you pay for! Never again will I stay at that hotel. I have been in contact with the Better Business Bureau and the City Council regarding this company.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: RoseMichaels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the process of being renovated. The windows do not open in any of the rooms so there was no way to vent the odor of fresh paint and new carpeting. The smell was overwhelming. The air conditioner was not adequate to cool the room. We had no hair dryer, ice bucket or glasses. There was no shelf in the shower to put our shower supplies. The shower was plugged so we spent the first night standing in 2â€� of water. The staff tried to unclog it the next day but were unsuccessful and the room smelled like chemicals when we returned. Again, no way to vent the room. We ended up moving the the 5th floor. Parking is scarce and the spaces are very small. No way to park a full size car or truck. Helon Meyers rm99844@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great!”
Reviews.Author: LovesAWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: When I initially booked the hotel it was a Ramada, so when I received my confirmation and saw that it was Hotel Five I was very worried. However, from the moment I stepped into the hotel my expectations were constantly exceeded with the nice and helpful staff to the trendy hotel rooms to the great location. I stayed on the 5th floor which was renovated, so that may explain the difference between my review and past reviews. The location was also great. It was a 7 minute walk to Pike's Place and 10 minute walk to the space needle. The only negative is parking is a bit tight. Considering I have paid $40/night for parking at some downtown hotels, I can't complain that much because it was less than $15/per night. Without a doubt, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch disaster!”
Reviews.Author: Tizmyn
Reviews.Content: Well I have earned lots of points using so many hotels so I always book using the same well known hotel chains. This trip was booked for a stay at the Ramada in Seattle. Well they took my money and when I arrived we found that it was no longer the "Ramada". They didn't say anything about that when we booked the room. The name is now "Hotel Five" and no longer affiliated with Ramada Inns. It was late and they had already charged our card. They then also told us we had to pay for parking in their parking lot. The Hotel is dirty, smells of dampness. Beds are possibly the worst I have had in 2 years of traveling. The staff was not helpful and didn't seem to really care about the "bait and switch" issue on the hotel reservation. No breakfast served either. Horrible Horrible Horrilble

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Five
HotelInfo.Address: 2200 5th Ave, Seattle, WA 98121
